enable-device-hotplug.title: Enable device hotplug mode
enable-device-hotplug.description: Allows to increase amount of RAM (ram-size) and CPU (cmp-count) without restart of the VM process, up to defined maximums (ram-max-size and cpu-max-count). Operation system have to support online addition of RAM and CPU.

ram-max-size.title: Maximum RAM size, in MB
ram-max-size.description: Define the maximum size of the memory. The size is in MB and should be a multiple of 512. Defaults to ram-size + 512

ram-hotplug-slot-size.title: Size of Hotpluggable RAM slot, in MB
ram-hotplug-slot-size.description: Define the RAM size to plug on one hotpluggable slot in MB, understand the size of one RAM bar. The RAM hotplugged on each slot will always have the same RAM size.

auto-ballooning.title: Enable qemu auto ballooning.
auto-ballooning.description: Enable virtio balloon device to allows KVM guests to reduce/re-increase their memory size.

disk-format.title: Type of disk drive to create by QEMU.
disk-format.description: Type of QEMU disk drive, to create.

disk-cache.title: Cache option to use with Disk.
disk-cache.description: Disk cache controls how the host cache is used to access block data.

disk-aio.title: Disk aio to use.
disk-aio.description: Selects between pthread based disk I/O and native Linux AIO.

cpu-max-count.title: Maximum CPU amount
cpu-max-count.description: Specifies the maximum number of CPUs. Defaults to cpu-count + 1

numa.title: Simulate a multi node NUMA system.
numa.description: Simulate a multi node NUMA system. If mem and cpus are omitted, resources are split equally. Each numa option are separated by space: node,nodeid=4,cpus=40-49,mem=64g node,nodeid=1,cpus=10-19,mem=128g. Set this option if you know what you're doing.

machine-options.title: Machine options.
machine-options.description: Select the emulated machine by name. Ex: pc-i440fx-2.4,accel=kvm

cpu-model.title: CPU model.
cpu-model.description: Select the emulated CPU model. Ex: SandyBridge,+erms,+smep,+smx,+vmx

network-adapter.title: Network adapter
network-adapter.description: Network adapter provided to the guest. Allows to support legacy guests, which do not have drivers for default virtio-net-pci.

nbd-host.title: NBD hostname
nbd-host.description: hostname (or IP) of the NBD server containing the boot image.

nbd-port.title: NBD port
nbd-port.description: Port of the NBD server containing the boot image.

nbd2-host.title: Second NBD hostname
nbd2-host.description: hostname (or IP) of the second NBD server (containing drivers for example).

nbd2-port.title: Second NBD port
nbd2-port.description: Port of the second NBD server containing the boot image.

virtual-hard-drive-url.title: Existing disk image URL
virtual-hard-drive-url.description: If specified, will download an existing disk image (qcow2, raw, ...), and will use it as main virtual hard drive. Can be used to download and use an already installed and customized virtual hard drive.

virtual-hard-drive-md5sum.title: Checksum of virtual hard drive
virtual-hard-drive-md5sum.description: MD5 checksum of virtual hard drive, required if virtual-hard-drive-url is specified.

virtual-hard-drive-gzipped.title: Define if virtual hard drive to download is gzipped
virtual-hard-drive-gzipped.description: Define if virtual hard drive to download is gzipped using gzip. This help to reduce size of file to download.

wipe-disk-ondestroy.title: Wipe disks when destroy the VM
wipe-disk-ondestroy.description: Say if disks should be wiped by writing new data over every single bit before delete them. This option is used to securely delete VM disks

wipe-disk-iterations.title: Wipe disk iterations
wipe-disk-iterations.description: Number of disk overwrite iterations with random data. Default is 1. WARNING: Increase this value will slow down partition destruction and increase IO.

use-tap.title: Use QEMU TAP network interface
use-tap.description: Use QEMU TAP network interface, requires taps creation on SlapOS Node.

nat-rules.title: List of rules for NAT of QEMU user mode network stack.
nat-rules.description: List of rules for NAT of QEMU user mode network stack, as space-separated list of ports (with optional protocol). For each port specified, it will redirect port x of the VM (example: "80 udp:53") to the port x + 10000 of the public IPv6 of the host (example: "10080 udp:10053").

nat-restrict-mode.title: Isolate the NAT Interface (No Internet access)
nat-restrict-mode.description: If this option is enabled, the NAT interface will be isolated, i.e. it will not be able to contact the host and no guest IP packets will be routed over the host to the outside. This option does not affect any explicitly set nat rules.

enable-vhost.title: Use vhost-net to improve network performance of tap interface
enable-vhost.description: The vhost-net provides much improved network performance for your VM. Only work if the vhost-net kernel module is loaded and available on host machine, please keep this option off if you're not shure.

monitor-interface-url.title: Monitor Web Interface URL
monitor-interface-url.description: Give Url of HTML web interface that will be used to render this monitor instance.

monitor-cors-domains.title: Monitor CORS domains
monitor-cors-domains.description: List of cors domains separated with space. Needed for ajax query on this monitor instance from a different domain.

enable-http-server.title: Enable local http server
enable-http-server.description: Set if local http server which serve files to the vm should be deployed. If set to true, get file into the vm with URL: http://10.0.2.100/FILE.

httpd-port.title: Local http server port
httpd-port.description: Port of the local http server used to share files.

authorized-key.title: Public keys to get from all virtual machines.
authorized-key.description: Set the public keys to add in your virtual machine. The public key file will be available in the VM via url http://10.0.2.100/authorized_keys if you keep the NAT interface enabled

bootstrap-script-url.title: VM bootstrap script URL.
bootstrap-script-url.description: If dedicaced disk image is used, this script will be downloaded and run at first boot of the virtual machine. Set md5sum to URL like: http://example.com/file#MD5SUM. Get file in vm at http://10.0.2.100/vm-bootstrap.

data-to-vm.title: Text content to send to this virtual machine.
data-to-vm.description: Text content which will be written in a file 'data' of http server of this virtual machine instance. The file will be available via URL: http://10.0.2.100/data in the VM.

frontend-instance-guid.title: Frontend Instance ID
frontend-instance-guid.description: Unique identifier of the frontend instance, like "SOFTINST-11031".

frontend-software-type.title: Frontend Software Type
frontend-software-type.description: Type of the frontend instance, like "frontend".

frontend-software-url.title: Frontend Software URL
frontend-software-url.description: Software Release URL of the frontend instance, like "http://example.com/path/to/software.cfg".

frontend-additional-instance-guid.title: Additional Frontend Instance ID
frontend-additional-instance-guid.description: Unique identifier of the additional frontend instance, like "SOFTINST-11031", if empty won't be requested.

frontend-additional-software-type.title: Additional Frontend Software Type
frontend-additional-software-type.description: Type of the frontend instance, like "frontend".

frontend-additional-software-url.title: Additional Frontend Software URL
frontend-additional-software-url.description: Software Release URL of the frontend instance, like "http://example.com/path/to/software.cfg".

boot-image-url-list.title: Boot image list
boot-image-url-list.description: The list shall be list of direct URLs to images, followed by hash (#), then by image MD5SUM. Each image shall appear on newline, like: "https://example.com/image.iso#06226c7fac5bacfa385872a19bb99684<newline>https://example.com/another-image.iso#31b40d58b18e038498ddb46caea1361c". They will be provided in KVM image list according to the order on the list. After updating the list, the instance has to be restarted to refresh it. Amount of images is limited to 4, and one image can be maximum 10G. Image will be downloaded and checked against its MD5SUM 4 times, then it will be considered as impossible to download with given MD5SUM. Each image has to be downloaded in time shorter than 4 hours, so in case of very slow images to access, it can take up to 16 hours to download all of them. Note: The instance has to be restarted in order to update the list of available images in the VM. Note: Maximum 3 ISOs are supported.

whitelist-domains.title: Whitelist domains
whitelist-domains.description: List of whitelisted domain names to be accessed from the VM. They will be resolved to IPs depending on where the VM end up. IPs can be used too.

external-disk.title: External disks
external-disk.description: Allows to set paths and types of manually provided external disks. Use index to order disks. Changing this parameter leads to kvm process restart.

path.title: Path of the provided image
path.description: Absolute or relative path (to the partition root path) of the provided image. Image has to be provided, with read and write permissions of the partition user. Please note, that if the name starts with 'rbd:' it's considered special and won't be used as relative path.

format.title: Format of a disk image
format.description: Format of a disk image. Note: rbd type is experimental.

cache.title: Cache value for the disk
cache.description: Cache value directly passed to the kvm -drive invocation as cache=value.

index.title: Index of a disk
index.description: An index value used to order disks for the VM, required if more than one disk is used to have stable ordering.
